metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4788 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The PTR_MANGLE implementation in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6)2.4, 2.17, and earlier, and Embedded GLIBC (EGLIBC) does not initialize therandom value for the pointer guard, which makes it easier forcontext-dependent attackers to control execution flow by leveraging abuffer-overflow vulnerability in an application and using the known zerovalue pointer guard to calculate a pointer address.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-armel - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-pic - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-ppc64 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.18-0ubuntu1
libc6-xen - 2.18-0ubuntu1
multiarch-support - 2.18-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.18-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18-0ubuntu1').
